page.title: 13LANGFORD BUDVILLE CHURCH
page.content: We are not certain when our church was actualy built but we think it was built in the 14th century.Before that there was a chapel. The church is made of a red sandstone with moss and lichen growing up it. There are 7 stained glass windows made of coloured glass and strips of lead. The pulpit, the altar, and the chancel pews are beautifully carved in wood. The other pews are also made of wood. The big wooden door, to enter the church, is inside the porch. Outside there are lots of different graves, some are very old, and some are quite new. There are also some tombs. The tower has a clock that faces the school and on the top there is a flag pole. The flag represents Saint George.
